dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Trending tickers: Nvidia, Oracle, Netflix, Adidas and JD Wetherspoon
News Content: Nvidia (NVDA)

Chipmaker Nvidia has overtaken Apple (AAPL) once again to become the world's most valuable company, after the company's shares rose in Tuesday's session.

Nvidia now has a market capitalisation of nearly $3.45tn (£2.79tn), compared to Apple's $3.35tn, with shares in the iPhone maker having fallen 3% in the previous session.

Shares in Nvidia climbed more than 2% on Tuesday and were up 2.5% in pre-market trading on Wednesday.

This came after newly reinstated president Donald Trump announced a new $500bn private sector investment to build artificial infrastructure in the US.

Read more: FTSE 100 LIVE: Stocks rise as UK borrowing jumps unexpectedly

Initial equity funders for the "Stargate Project" are OpenAI, Oracle (ORCL), SoftBank (9984.T) and MGX, while Nvidia is one of the initial technology partners.

Ben Barringer, technology analyst at Quilter Cheviot, said: "This development is undeniably a boon for the AI sector. Companies involved in supplying the technology and infrastructure for Project Stargate are well-positioned to benefit significantly.

"The move underscores the increasing strategic importance of AI innovation, further solidifying its role as a cornerstone of economic and technological advancement. For investors in the AI space, this announcement highlights a wealth of opportunities as the competition to dominate the sector intensifies."

•USD

(NVDA)

Follow  View Quote Details

Oracle (ORCL)

Shares in Oracle jumped 7% on Tuesday and were up 8% in pre-market trading on Wednesday morning, following Trump's announcement.

The stock was also trending after Trump reportedly said at event on Tuesday that he would be open to Oracle chairman Larry Ellison or Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk purchasing social media app TikTok, as part of a joint venture with the US government.

According to a Bloomberg report, Trump said: "I have the right to make a deal."

"So what I’m thinking about saying to somebody is buy it and give half to the United States of America, half, and we’ll give you the permit, and they’ll have a great partner," he added.

Read more: Pound, gold and oil prices in focus: commodity and currency check, 22 January

In one of his early actions after being sworn in for a second presidential term on Monday, Trump signed an executive order to delay the ban of TikTok in the US.

When asked about Trump's proposal that TikTok-owner, Chinese company ByteDance, hand over half of the platform to a US company, China foreign ministry spokesperson Guo Jiakun said: "TikTok has operated in the US for years and been very popular with American users."

Story Continues

"It has played a positive role in boosting US employment and consumption. We hope the US will earnestly listen to the voice of reason and provide an open, fair, just and non-discriminatory business environment for market entities from all countries."

•USD

(ORCL)

Follow  View Quote Details

Netflix (NFLX)

Shares in Netflix soared 14% in pre-market trading on Wednesday, after the streaming giant reported 18.9 million users in the fourth quarter, with revenue and earnings also beating expectations.

Revenue of $8.83bn for the fourth quarter was up 12.5% year-on-year and diluted earnings per share came in at $2.11 for the final three months of its fiscal year.

The company also announced a $15bn share buyback and raised its full-year revenue outlook to come in between $43.5bn and $44.5bn. That was ahead of its prior range of $43bn to $44bn.

Read more: Stocks that are trending today

Strong subscriber gains came on the back of Netflix ending 2024 with two back-to-back NFL games, a successful "Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson" boxing match, and the return of the highly-popular "Squid Game" series.

Matt Britzman, senior equity analyst at Hargreaves Lansdown (HL.L), said: "Netflix keeps us hooked with fresh content slates, drawing millions of new viewers while keeping existing customers happy at the same time. This is the last quarter Netflix will report net subscriber growth, and it’s blown expectations out of the water.

"While rivals hike prices and wrestle with losses, Netflix is raking in cash and striking deals like WWE and NFL to strengthen its lineup. Competitors selling their best shows to Netflix only make its library stronger, keeping us watching – and, crucially, paying."

•USD

(NFLX)

Follow  View Quote Details

Adidas (ADS.DE)

In Europe, shares in sportswear brand Adidas surged nearly 7% on Wednesday morning, after the company posted stronger-than-expected preliminary fourth quarter results.

Adidas revenues grew 24% to €5.97bn (£5.05tn) in the fourth quarter, while operating profit reached €57m in the quarter, versus an operating loss of €377m.

Stocks: Create your watchlist and portfolio

The jump in the shares helped drive the pan-European STOXX 600 (^STOXX) to an all-time high on Wednesday morning.

Deutsche Bank analysts said in a note on Wednesday that they had a "buy" rating on the stock.

"Our buy case on Adidas is built on increasing brand heat, positive earnings momentum and strong EPS growth," they said. "All of this is evidenced again in 4Q."

•USD

(ADS.DE)

Follow  View Quote Details

JD Wetherspoon (JDW.L)

Shares in UK pub operator JD Wetherspoon dipped nearly 2% into the red on Wednesday, after the company's chairman Tim Martin warned of higher costs.

Martin had already warned that costs at Wetherspoons would increase this year by £60m per annum, on the back of increases in the autumn budget to employer national insurance contributions and the national minimum wage.

Read more: Higher-than-expected UK borrowing heaps pressure on Rachel Reeves

"Government-mandated wage increases have a significantly bigger impact on pub and restaurant companies than supermarkets," Martin said.

Derren Nathan, head of equity research at Hargreaves Lansdown (HL.L), said: "There’s no more vociferous campaigner for landlord rights than chairman Tim Martin who has pointed out that volumes of pub’s biggest product line, beer, have collapsed by 52% between 2000 and 2023.

"Average on-trade prices are now at £4.98 per pint and far more sensitive to labour cost increases than supermarket equivalents, where you can pick up 568 ml of refreshment for an average price of £1.20."

In the trading update, JD Wetherspoon reported 5.1% growth in like-for-like sales.

•USD

(JDW.L)

Follow  View Quote Details

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The news indicates that Nvidia has overtaken Apple in market capitalization, which may negatively impact investor sentiment towards Apple. Additionally, Apple's shares fell 3% in the previous session, suggesting a bearish trend. The focus on AI and Nvidia's growth could further divert attention from Apple, leading to a higher probability of a stock price decline. However, the overall market sentiment and Apple's strong brand may provide some support, but the prevailing news suggests a higher likelihood of a price drop.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news indicates Apple's stock fell 3% in the previous session and Nvidia has overtaken Apple as the world's most valuable company. This suggests negative sentiment towards Apple. While Apple is mentioned alongside other trending tickers, the primary focus is on Nvidia's success at Apple's expense. There is no specific positive news about Apple in this article to counteract the negative sentiment.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.2, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news primarily focuses on other companies, with Apple's mention being incidental to Nvidia surpassing it as the most valuable company.  Apple's stock fell 3% in the previous session, and the news doesn't offer any specific positive catalysts for Apple. While the overall market sentiment might be positive due to the AI investment news, this is unlikely to significantly impact Apple's stock price in the short term, given its lack of direct involvement in the "Stargate Project". The probability of a price rise is therefore low, while the probability of a fall or sideways movement is higher, given the recent 3% drop and the lack of positive news directly related to Apple.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news highlights that Apple Inc. (AAPL) has been overtaken by Nvidia (NVDA) as the world's most valuable company, with Apple's shares having fallen 3% in the previous session. This indicates a negative sentiment towards Apple in the short term due to losing its top position. Additionally, the focus of the news is more on Nvidia, Oracle, Netflix, Adidas, and JD Wetherspoon, with limited direct impact on Apple mentioned. The lack of positive catalysts for Apple in this news suggests a higher probability of the stock price falling or remaining stagnant rather than rising.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news headline mentions several companies, but the content specifically impacts Apple (AAPL) in relation to Nvidia (NVDA) becoming the world's most valuable company. Nvidia's rise and Apple's fall in market capitalization, along with Apple's 3% drop in the previous session, may negatively impact Apple's stock price in the short term. However, the overall market and sector performance could influence Apple's stock movement. Given Nvidia's surge and the positive sentiment around AI investments, there's a potential for Apple's stock to face challenges, but it's also possible that Apple's strong fundamentals could mitigate the immediate negative impact.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.2, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.8, Reasoning: The news article mentions that Nvidia has overtaken Apple as the world's most valuable company, with Nvidia's market capitalization reaching nearly $3.45tn and Apple's market capitalization at $3.35tn. Additionally, Apple's shares fell 3% in the previous session. This suggests that Apple's stock price may be negatively affected by the news.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news primarily focuses on other companies such as Nvidia, Oracle, Netflix, and Adidas, with little direct mention of Apple. The decline in Apple's market cap relative to Nvidia could potentially affect investor sentiment towards Apple, but there is no direct news that impacts Apple's immediate stock price movement.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news highlights that Nvidia has overtaken Apple in market capitalization, which may negatively impact investor sentiment towards Apple. Additionally, Apple's shares fell 3% in the previous session, indicating a bearish trend. The focus on Nvidia's success and the AI investment news does not provide any positive catalysts for Apple, leading to a higher probability of a stock price decline. While Apple's strong brand may offer some support, the prevailing sentiment suggests a greater likelihood of a price drop.",
```
